page.title: 03TYDD ST. GILES-CHURCH(cont)
page.content: There is proof that the chancel was there, because the churchyard path is going round an empty space.In 1278 the Archdeacon of Ely visited the church because the Bishop of Ely owned the village.The earliest recorded rector in the church was Nicholas de Houton.He was the rector in 1320.Nicholas Breakspeare was a curate at the church.Later he became the only English pope,Adrian IV. Neither the church nor the village is mentioned in Domesday Book.This may be because the village was not founded in 1086,but is more probably because all the manors belonging to the Abbot of Ely were included in the entry for Wisbech.
